CatDescriptText: Mr. Kenneth Moore, 425 Chalfont Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?" answer reads: "I live in Beltzhoover and we have facilities for the children including such things as Cub and Girl Scouts. For the number of children in our area, I would say that the recreational facilities are adequate.  Other things which we have are teen-age clubs.  Also, there are three playgrounds along in the Chalfont area.  In general, I would say that we are doing good."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Kenneth Moore, wearing diagonally striped necktie, and light colored trench coat, standing in front of block wall with smoking pipe display in store window
